pullRequest.body:
The `nerve` functor is 2-coskeletal. This is a major lemma in the construction of the nerve adjunction.

Co-Authored-By: Emily Riehl <eriehl@jhu.edu> and Pietro Monticone <38562595+pitmonticone@users.noreply.github.com>

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

- [x] depends on: #16781
* Prerequisite for #16784.

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

This PR/issue depends on:
* ~~leanprover-community/mathlib4#16781~~
By **[Dependent Issues](https://github.com/z0al/dependent-issues)** (ðŸ¤–). Happy coding!
<!-- By Dependent Issues (Action) - DO NOT REMOVE -->

Could you split this PR? I would suggest starting with a PR with only the definition of `Path`, `Path.interval`, and strict Segal simplicial sets and their basic API. As the file `SimplicialSet.Basic` is already long, I would suggest put `Path`, `Path.interval` in a new file `SimplicialSet.Path`, and the basic definitions of spine and strict Segal simplicial sets in a file `SimplicialSet.StrictSegal`.

(Similarly, the main results should go in a file distinct of `SimplicialSet.Nerve` so that `Nerve.lean` no longer imports `Functor.KanExtension.*`.)

It seems that this is the critical part. I would suggest introducing paths in simplicial sets as follows, and showing that if a simplicial set `X` is such that the type of `n`-simplices maps bijectively to `X.Path n` for all `n`, then the associated right extension is a pointwise right Kan extension: 
```lean
namespace SSet

open CategoryTheory

variable (X : SSet.{u})

@[ext]
structure Path (n : â„•) where
  vertex (i : Fin (n + 1)) : X _[0]
  arrow (i : Fin n) : X _[1]
  arrow_src (i : Fin n) : X.Î´ 1 (arrow i) = vertex i.castSucc
  arrow_tgt (i : Fin n) : X.Î´ 0 (arrow i) = vertex i.succ

@[simps]
def toPath (n : â„•) (Î” : X _[n]) :
    X.Path n where
  vertex i := X.map (SimplexCategory.const [0] [n] i).op Î”
  arrow i := X.map (SimplexCategory.mkOfLe _ _ i.castSucc_le_succ).op Î”
  arrow_src i := by
    dsimp [SimplicialObject.Î´]
    simp only [â† FunctorToTypes.map_comp_apply, â† op_comp]
    apply congr_fun
    congr 2
    ext i
    fin_cases i
    rfl
  arrow_tgt i := by
    dsimp [SimplicialObject.Î´]
    simp only [â† FunctorToTypes.map_comp_apply, â† op_comp]
    apply congr_fun
    congr 2
    ext i
    fin_cases i
    rfl

lemma toPath_nerve_bijective (C : Type u) [Category.{v} C] (n : â„•) :
    Function.Bijective ((nerve C).toPath n) := by
  constructor
  Â· intro Î” Î”' h
    exact ComposableArrows.ext
      (fun i â†¦ Functor.congr_obj (congr_fun (congr_arg Path.vertex h) i) 0)
      (fun i hi â†¦ congr_hom (congr_fun (congr_arg Path.arrow h) âŸ¨i, hiâŸ©) (show 0 âŸ¶ 1 by tauto))
  Â· intro F
    exact âŸ¨ComposableArrows.mkOfObjOfMapSucc (fun i â†¦ (F.vertex i).obj 0)
      (fun i â†¦ eqToHom (Functor.congr_obj (F.arrow_src i).symm 0) â‰«
        (F.arrow i).map' 0 1 â‰« eqToHom (Functor.congr_obj (F.arrow_tgt i) 0)), ?_âŸ©
    ext i
    Â· exact ComposableArrows.extâ‚€ rfl
    Â· refine ComposableArrows.extâ‚ ?_ ?_ ?_
      Â· exact Functor.congr_obj (F.arrow_src i).symm 0
      Â· exact Functor.congr_obj (F.arrow_tgt i).symm 0
      Â· dsimp
        apply ComposableArrows.mkOfObjOfMapSucc_map_succ

@[simps!]
def rightExtensionInclusion (n : â„•) :
    RightExtension (Truncated.inclusion (n := n)).op
      (Functor.op Truncated.inclusion â‹™ X) :=
  RightExtension.mk _ (ðŸ™ _)

noncomputable def rightExtensionInclusionâ‚‚IsPointwiseRightKanExtensionAt
    (hX : âˆ€ (n : â„•), Function.Bijective (X.toPath n)) (n : â„•) :
    (X.rightExtensionInclusion 2).IsPointwiseRightKanExtensionAt âŸ¨[n]âŸ© := sorry

end SSet
```
(This is related to a criteria which identifies which simplicial sets are the nerve of a category.)
(The ingredients in the proof should be roughly the same. Hopefully, it may be a little bit less painful.)
Thanks for the suggestion. Less pain sounds good! I'll get to work.

Using the operator `-` on `â„•` or `Fin n` creates a lot of annoyance. I suggest parametrizing the tuples `(j â‰¤ k)` which appear in several places as `(j, j + l)`:
```lean
def Path.interval {n : â„•} (f : Path X n) (j l : â„•) (hjl : j + l â‰¤ n) :
    Path X l where
  vertex i := f.vertex âŸ¨j + i, by omegaâŸ©
  arrow i := f.arrow âŸ¨j + i, by omegaâŸ©
  arrow_src i := f.arrow_src âŸ¨j + i, by omegaâŸ©
  arrow_tgt i := f.arrow_tgt âŸ¨j + i, by omegaâŸ©
```

If would be nice to add two lemmas in `SimplexCategory.lean`, like:
```lean
@[simp]
lemma Î´_one_mkOfSucc {n : â„•} (i : Fin n) :
    Î´ 1 â‰« mkOfSucc i = SimplexCategory.const _ _ i.castSucc := by
  ext x
  fin_cases x
  aesop
```

pullRequest.title: feat(AlgebraicTopology/Nerve): nerve is 2-coskeletal
